reviewDescription: The projector is very small and compact.  Easy to transport from room to room or back yard parties.  Very user-friendly operation and on-screen menu to select type of input.  The room needs to be very dark for best picture and the sound on the projector Is adequate but can be greatly enhanced by adding a bluetooth or wired speaker using a 3mm connection.  HDMI provides best picture but can also use pictures and video from a USB or TF camera card.  Very good projector for the money, especially with current price reduction.

reviewTitle: Absolutely Fantastic Portable Projector for the price
reviewDescription: ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐ Absolutely Fantastic Portable Projector!I recently purchased the TMY Mini Projector, and I couldn't be more thrilled with my decision! The quality of this projector is outstanding, especially considering its compact size. The 1080P Full HD resolution delivers crisp and clear images, whether I'm watching movies indoors or hosting an outdoor movie night. The upgraded Bluetooth feature is a game-changer, allowing seamless connectivity with my smartphone and other devices.Setup was a breeze, and I appreciate the variety of connection options available, including HDMI and USB, which makes it versatile for all my needs. The included screen is a nice bonus, and it really enhances the overall viewing experience. Despite its small size, this projector packs a punch and is easily portable, making it perfect for travel or moving between rooms.Overall, this projector exceeded my expectations in every way. If you're in the market for a reliable, high-quality projector for both indoor and outdoor use, I highly recommend the TMY Mini Projector. It's worth every penny!

This mini projector is great for watching videos in a room. The picture quality is great, and it is easy to set up. I connected to a bluetooth speaker, making the sound louder. It is also portable, and can be used with many different electronic devices such as laptops and iPads. I would recommend this product if you are looking for a small, portable projector that will be used for watching movies and videos.

reviewTitle: Turned out better than I thought!
reviewDescription: Ok so when I got this I was thinking it was going to be used strictly inside my garage office as a 4th computer monitor and it wasn’t going to be good for much else. I quickly realized this projector is much better than I thought and decided to set it up as an outdoor backyard patio movie projector! If you see my video ive posted I show you how easy and portable it is. Because it is lightweight and compact and works with a basic camera/light tripod it means you don’t need to purchase a separate stand. The 1/4” thread/screw at the bottom works with most camera tripods. For under $100 you’re getting great value, great picture quality, and easy setup. The Bluetooth feature is very nice as well and I was able to connect my two Sonos Roam speakers and use it as a pair of surround speakers. Also the fact that I am using an Amazon fire stick with it makes watching movies and shows very convenient. It is a simple and sleek design that goes great with our white/modern house setup. I am very happy with this purchase and feel it offers great entertainment value. My final thoughts is if you have a controlled environment where you’re able to keep the area dark, you’re going to get a very good picture quality experience. Bright rooms will not do as well regardless if your have a good screen or not. Overall 5 stars for being affordable yet producing a quality video/picture!

reviewTitle: You will be happy if you have the right expectations
reviewDescription: This projector is excellent for the price. I paid $99. (A $20 coupon was available for some reason which brought it down to $99 from $119)For night-time viewing with no grand expectations you will be pleased.It got a genuine "wow" from the wife and kids. They've watched a few hours on it so far with delight.We have an Apple TV plugged into it.NOTEIf you are the kind of person that will fret over non-premium features then you may need to step up to something at least 6x the price (but ideally >20x the price) to avoid triggering your nerves. This is a fantastic budget buy... don't buy it with the wrong expectations.SOUND:Like other reviewers I expected garbage sound quality from the internal speaker and was therefore surprised that it was similar to a half-decent little portable USB speaker. I plan to use external speakers but the internal one didn't get any negative comments from the initial audience (of undiscerning family members) which is a pleasant bonus. Great to just be able to throw up a movie with almost zero setup.FOCUS & KEYSTONE:It has a mechanical keystone. You shift a roller and it presumably tilts one of the lenses inside (probably all-plastic internal components made with the kind of manufacturing tolerances you'd expect at this price point). On the plus side, this mechanical keystone means you can quickly straighten up the image on the wall +/- 15 degrees. However, you will discover that the image cannot be uniformly focused when keystone is being used. If you use keystone you will have to focus the center of the image and tolerate some focus imperfection at the top and bottom of the frame.The focus is also a mechanical roller. Even at a perfectly level projection angle (i.e. no keystone, where the bottom of the projected image is precisely in line with the lens of the projector) you may need to tolerate some minor focus imperfections. I don't use any keystone on mine and the extremities are less crisp than the rest of the image. I can notice it when projecting text (e.g. the text at the top-right of the Netflix interface) but it is minor and doesn't impair the experience watching tv/movies. When I pointed it out to my wife she didn't care. Nobody cares.If you buy this expecting optics developed in a Swiss engineering lab with professional grade tolerances you should probably take another look at the price... it's not than kind of product.THROW SIZE:There is no mechanical zoom. We have it mounted on a wall in a room that is 11 feet to the opposite wall (i.e. the *back* of the projector is 11 feet from the projection wall). At this distance our image has a diagonal of ~106 inches.There is a digital "zoom" function in the menus that let you reduce the picture size... probably at the cost of some fidelity. Good to have that feature in a pinch but we aren't using it.BRIGHTNESS:At 11 feet out the brightness is decent for watching at night. That is all that we want it for. Again, the wife and kids were stoked.You will probably not want to use it with the lights on (washes it out) and certainly not in any daylight, so don't buy it to replace an all-purpose TV. Also, don't try to make side-by-side comparisons with your LCD/LED/OLED TV... contrast in dark scenes will be far inferior and brightness in general will be far less uniform. If you project an entirely "black" screen you will see a range of slightly lighter and darker areas. Again, nobody in my house noticed or cared and I was happy to count the money I saved. To get a projector that will work with lots of ambient light and produce a very uniform brightness you really need to jump a long way up the price ladder. What you get out of this projector is very solid for the money.MANUAL & ACCESSORIES:I haven't tried out the included basic projection screen. It's a soft fabric with eight metal eyelets around it (one in each corner and one half-way along each side). They ship it with 8 plastic hooks and 8 tabs of double-sided tape so you can mount it on a wall without drilling. It has a black outer border. Seems fine. Nice touch including it... adds to the crazy good value of this product.The remote is fine (uses 2x AAA).They include all the cables you need: VGA, HDMI, power (US style). They all work.The included manual is clear and covers most of what you might want to know. TMY invites you to contact them by email for support. I haven't needed to do that yet so I can't say how responsive they are.OTHER COMMENTSFan noise is comparable to other projectors of this size (in my experience) and so is no cause for special praise or complaint. We're happy with it.I can't comment on the color fidelity etc. because I'm somewhat color blind. All I can say is, you see vibrant colors, there is some image configurability in the menus and nobody had anything bad to say about the colors. I'm sure if you started testing it's color space you'd find all kinds of limitations but... again... nobody cares.I've asked my teenage son what he thought of the color just now and his answer was "I don't think any of us have any problem with the projector dad. It's great."TMY *are* incentivizing reviews on Amazon by offering a gift. There is a little insert card in the box along with the manual. It says "Happy with this purchase: 1. Share your experience by leaving an honest Review" and then it shows a picture of five stars. So I guess they are not specifically asking people to leave a five star review to get a reward but they are hinting at it pretty strongly. They also say "Not happy with this purchase: 1. Please give us a chance before you leave a 1-3 star review on Amazon or return the product" and then they ask you to please contact them directly to get a solution/replacement/refund etc. I think it's kind'a fair enough? Not much different to what hotels do to try getting their online reviews up. I'd decided to leave a review before I saw this card... I mention it in case people reading the reviews would like to know of potential influence.I have only had the projector a couple of days so I can't comment on longevity. They do claim to offer a 3 year warranty. I will update my review if it bombs out though.SUMMARYIt works and it's mind-bending value. How can you produce something like this profitably for $99 let alone ship it and let Amazon take their cut? Taking the family out for dinner and movie (back when that was allowed) would easily consume that amount of cash. I just hope it lasts. Very happy so far.

I was so close to returning this. I bought it, because my place has a lot of wonderful windows and art, but leaves no room for a TV. Also, when I sit at my art table, I have to keep my laptop way across the room on my bed to get the best wifi signal, so it is very hard to see. So a friend suggested getting a projector! I could also put it away when not using it which was ideal for a small space. Anyway  I bought this because it said I could use it with my laptop and the hdmi cord it comes with. Unfortunately, I am not a tech guru, and realized uoon its arrival that my computer is old and only has a VGA slot. (My IT brother told me that. Should have asked him first.) Anyway, he valiently tried to help me order two cords that adapted the VGA to HDMI and he spent an hour trying to make my computer accept this decade old tech difference, to no avail. Then I realized the product had said it accepts things like a Roku stick and I happened to have a coupon for that, so I bought one. For anyone who does this, learn from my trial and error: at some point the Roku setup requires you to pair your remote's volume capabilities "to the TV". BUT as previously stated, I do not have one. So after calling Roku and searching online to no avail, out of desperation, I continued with the pairing process by pretending I had a Samsung TV I was trying to pair it with. It finally gave up and asked me if I wanted to skip this step for now. (Yes, PLEASE) So it finally let me get to the main Roku page. I also downloaded the app and use the remote in that instead. The projector's remote works very well for the volume too. Anyway, I was able to hang the projector screen/cloth it gave me on my fireplace mantle and the projector works great! I did art for 3 hours. The sound is great, the image good (During the day with my window blinds open while doing art is kind of hard to see, but better than my previous tiny laptop view). At night, the experience is like being at the movies in my own studio! Now I can have friends over too and we won't have to squeeze on my twin bed trying to watch a movie on my laptop. This projector has solved so many of my show/movie watching issues now that I figured out how to use it with Roku. It was an uphill battle for me as an unlikely tech person, but I refused to give up. I told my brother he is helping me move beyond 1995 tech knowledge. But the biggest issue for me was that 1. my laptop was too old and didn't have hdmi and 2. the Roku set up sent me in circles trying to pair the remote until I pretended to pair it with a fake TV. Then getting the app remote up. So, those are tips for any other non-techie people out there. The projector itself is very easy to use and works great!

reviewTitle: EDITED: Very happy with customer service
reviewDescription: EDIT: to say I’m happy with the customer service is an understatement. They went above and beyond to make sure my needs were met. I got 1080p WiFi Bluetooth projector (not this mini one) and the visuals are much much better. The sound is much much better as well. Very happy. I will be returning and recommending this store to others!———— previous review ————I use my projector as my full time tv in my bedroom, so I use it a lot. My older projector bulbs started getting pretty dim (I couldn’t find replacement bulbs) so I bought a new one. This one had great reviews but I have to disagree. The best focus that it gets it’s still grainy and the sound quality is very flat (for lack of a better term). I was hoping for more “surround sound” quality. BUT overall, I’m not horribly disappointed. It’ll get me by until I save for a more expensive one. It’s good for the price point, just not what I was hoping for based on other reviews

Overall i am very pleased with it especially as an iphone user. I usually prop my phone on a remote to watch youtube when trying to sleep, i thought of this projector as a cool solution.Pros & Cons:-Pro: very good image quality-possible Con: I only tested it from a distance of behind my bed which i would approximate as maybe 2.5-3 meters and in a dark room, im not sure the projected light is strong enough if i use it outside in the moonlit sky but the weather is terrible so i am yet to try that or the sheet to project on thats included with it.-Pro & Con: the power cable is a Type A which i dont use in the middle east and which i despise as the slightest bit of tension would pull it out making it an electric hazard BUT the power cable is detachable (it can be removed), i was able to buy another cable (Type G) from a phones and electronics shop which is what i hope is available as an option when buying products from oversees so that is a big Pro for me.-Con: Audio; the speaker is strong but at high volume is not very clear which is expected for a projector at this price but if you’re sitting in a quiet room and casually watching a video on youtube or something or on netflix that doesnt require epic level audio then its really good when you lower the volune a bit and adjust the Bass level in the settings using the remote, otherwise you can connect speakers through the AUX port or with bluetooth which means you’ll get that epic audio if you want.Tip for Iphone connection: you will need a “Lightning to HDMI adapter”, i bought a cheap one which didnt work so you have to buy the original because apple products will detect fake products when you plug them in… OR you can buy what i did, i didnt know it existed till today (i will include the pic), its a wireless connector “wireless display dongle”, i plug it in and press the button on it and it will show up in my wifi settings like its an option as a wifi router without having to plug into the phone which i think is what makes it work.Anyways, story of my life written here 😂Overall very happy with it and would recommend.

reviewTitle: Even my adult kids are impressed with this projector
reviewDescription: I like that we can use this projector in multiple ways, DVD, cd and wifi.I also like that it connects to my Bluetooth speaker.The instructions are not that clear on how to connect to wifi and I'm not all that knowledgeable when it comes to electronics, so good thing my son was able to help me.It's very portable and small but for as small as it is, it puts out a large and clear picture.I also like that there are 4 options to view the picture. We chose the back  setting so that we didn't have the projector between us and the screen.This projector was a huge success and we can't wait to have another family backyard campout again, watching movies.

I love my new TMY mini projector! It’s perfect for movie nights and really easy to set up. The picture quality is amazing for such a small device, with vibrant colors and sharp images. The compact size makes it super convenient to move around, and it doesn't take up much space. I ordered an HDMI adapter to connect it to my MacBook, which has a type C port, and it works perfectly!The built-in speakers are pretty good for a mini projector, delivering clear sound that's great for smaller rooms. However, there's also an option to connect external speakers for a more immersive audio experience, which I really appreciate. The projector has multiple input options, including HDMI, USB, and AV, making it versatile and compatible with various devices like laptops, smartphones, and gaming consoles.Setting it up was a breeze—just plug and play! The remote control makes it easy to navigate through settings and adjust the volume or focus without having to get up. It's also lightweight and portable, so I can easily take it with me for outdoor movie nights, camping trips, or to a friend’s house for a fun movie marathon.The fan is quiet and doesn’t distract from the movie experience. Plus, the lamp life is impressive, ensuring many hours of entertainment. For the price, this mini projector offers fantastic value. It's a great investment for anyone looking to enhance their home entertainment setup without breaking the bank. Highly recommend!

The TMY Mini Projector comes across as a budget-friendly option with a few pros and cons that could make or break your experience, depending on your needs.Setup & Usability: ⭐⭐⭐⭐☆The setup process was refreshingly simple. Navigating the menu was straightforward, and the HDMI port made connecting my Roku stick a breeze. It’s a plug-and-play kind of device, which is always appreciated. The included screen was nothing to write home about, and the adhesive for the hooks was dried out and unusable. This was a disappointing aspect, as it added an unnecessary hassle to the setup process.Image Quality: ⭐⭐☆☆☆This projector offers a native 720p resolution at 60Hz, with the ability to upscale to 1080p. In dark environments, the image quality is adequate for casual viewing. However, any ambient light in the room quickly washes out the picture, making it difficult to see clearly. This limitation makes it less versatile for use in different lighting conditions.Sound Quality: ⭐☆☆☆☆Unfortunately, sound is where the TMY Mini Projector really struggles. The built-in speakers are quiet, and the audio becomes significantly distorted once you pass 50% volume. The non-linear volume scale is also problematic, with noticeable loudness only kicking in around 80%, but by then, the distortion is unbearable. Bluetooth audio didn’t fare any better; it was equally distorted at higher volumes. I had to resort to using the Roku app connected to a soundbar to achieve acceptable audio quality.Portability: ⭐⭐☆☆☆One of the highlights of this projector is its portability. It’s lightweight and compact, making it easy to move around. However, this portability comes at a cost—the lack of adjustability. Manual focus and manual up-and-down keystone adjustments are available, but there’s no way to correct for left-right off-center alignment, making it challenging to get the picture level without some finagling.Fan Noise: ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐On the plus side, the fan noise is quiet and unobtrusive. It’s not audible over the show you’re watching, which is a welcome relief in a budget projector.Features: ⭐☆☆☆☆There are no standout features to speak of, which is expected at this price point. The projector’s manual focus and keystone adjustments are basic, and there are no advanced options for correcting off-center alignment.Value for Money:⭐☆☆☆☆The value of the TMY Mini Projector depends heavily on what you’re looking for. If your kids are clamoring for a projector to use for fun movie nights, this could be a great entry-level option. However, if you’re in the market for a TV replacement or a serious home theater setup, this projector falls short in several key areas, including brightness, audio quality, and adjustability.Final Thoughts:This projector has its share of issues, from distorted Bluetooth audio and a scratched lens right out of the box to disappointing brightness that struggles even in moderately lit rooms. While it’s an affordable and portable option, I can’t recommend it as a replacement for a TV or as a serious entertainment device. For casual, dark-room use, especially by kids, it might serve its purpose. But for anything more, you’ll likely be left wanting more.Rating: ⭐⭐☆☆☆ (2/5)

reviewTitle: Deceptively dim projector, not even a quarter as bright as rated. It's a toy.
reviewDescription: This was to be used alongside an Epson EX5210 projector (rated at 2800 lumens, a ~$600 unit) for backdrops to musical performance. Despite being rated at "9500 lumens", this projector at max brightness struggled to compare to the Epson set as low as it can go. (There's a great review by Hermetia illucens that talks about "ANSI Lumens" that explains why this is. Color rendering is pretty terrible too. The keystone correction is really limited, so that if you try to ceiling mount at 8' and project on a wall, you won't be able to get the top and bottom in focus with the center of the image. There is no skew correction to speak of, so it has to be dead-on straight as well. The image quality and brightness is fine I guess for home movies in absolute darkness, but you can forget about using this alongside any kind of other lights, in a business setting, or any use case that requires off-axis adjustment.I should have known better given the price, but we had a limited budget and had to give it a shot. I had low expectations and was still disappointed.Pros:- cheap- lightweight- low power- "simple" aka almost no configuration optionsCons:- dim- feels flimsy- bad color rendering, washed out- almost no configuration options- no skew correction- very limited keystone correction- lots of slop in the focus ring, hard to focus, easily goes out of focus with any jostle- fan is kinda loudDidn't bother to test sound or bluetooth.

reviewTitle: Lens are scratched/ screen is too thin
reviewDescription: I was expecting a little bit more from this projector but I was dissatisfied. The lens was scratched at arrival which was a bummer. I plugged it in to see if it would affect the image. The bulb is not bright enough, so even with a blacked out room you will have a hard time with movies that are in darker tones. The screen itself wad too thin. This made the image look blurry, to the point Im just using the wall for the image itself.Like I said, I was expecting a little more

for almost $100 I was expecting more from this. I tried adjusting both knobs to make the screen clear and it’s still slightly blurry no matter how much I mess with it. I have had a projector from this brand before and LOVED it but I must have gotten a different model this time because it isn’t the same. the speaker also sounds muffled. it’s frustrating because I was expecting the same quality as my last projector and this entirely missed the mark.

It’s old fashion,Looks like it was made in “94” and the focus is horrible and blurry. I rarely leave reviews, only if the product is very satisfying or terribly bad. And this product do not recommend to no one seriously. I’m upset and want my money back but don’t feel like the hassle, should have followed my first mind and went to TIkTok shop. Waste of money. And Bluetooth does not work.

reviewTitle: You get what you pay for
reviewDescription: The projector gives you exactly what you would expect at the price you pay for it. The video quality is OK, but the colors aren't the best. The fan inside of it is very loud, making it hard to focus on what you are actually watching, unless you drown it out with loud speakers. The set-up is easy, and it connects well to Ipads, laptops etc.

Pros: easy to setup; comes with a projector screen (albeit a flimsy thin piece of cloth)Cons: the focus is not uniform throughout the screen. If the middle is focused, the bottom part of screen is blurry. If bottom part is focused, then top and middle are blurry. Also, unless you have an HDCP compliant HDPE to HDPE cable AND an HDCP compliant HDPE to lightning cable, then you won’t be able to stream Netflix or other streaming apps from your phone to the screen

First it makes an annoying sound and eventually it will make you want to throw it out the window and you won’t enjoy your movie. It’s also difficult to set up that I’ve already filed to return it. I rather buy an actual TV. Might work for someone else but not me. It also says it’s Bluetooth I may have done something wrong but the projector doesn’t produce any sound besides it’s annoying broken fan noise. Just no

I bought this to connect to my MacBook Air (2022) or iPhone 14 and it either crashes them or won’t play audio through the projector. Tested with much older Samsung galaxy and thinkpad and it worked better. Would caution against this product for newer and/or apple products.

reviewTitle: It is not working on Youtube and Netflix! The company lies!
reviewDescription: It was delivered on time! However, when I tried to connect the device, the manual does not help!! Try to email the supplier, not replied neither! So, I have to return it. I rarely return Amazon product! This product is really bad!

I loved the price, and I love that it is so versatile with connections, but sadly my iPad is too old and won't allow me to play from my streaming services- not this product's fault at all! It works wonderfully and while the speaker is not the best, connecting it to a Bluetooth speaker really helps enhance the experience.

This projector is spectacular. It has wonderful visibility. It has loudspeaker and it comes with its own remote and directions on how to set up everything. I am very happy with this product and glad I got this one!

It has been the best little projector I’ve bought. I do highly recommend adding a speaker to it if you want it to be so everyone can hear other than that it’s absolutely amazing! Very happy with this product!

This projector is a fantastic addition to any home entertainment setup! With stunning image quality and vibrant colors, it delivers a true cinematic experience. Setup is straightforward, and the connectivity options are seamless, making streaming a breeze. Highly recommend!
Purchased for my living room so the kiddos can watch movies. It arrived quickly. I just have to figure out the right speaker to hook up for louder sound. We love it will be replacing TV's for these

This combo of the projector and the screen really exceeded my expectations. I would suggest buying this TMY projector to anyone looking for a hassle free setup. I haven’t had any issues and enjoy all the adjustments available to really focus the picture.Most of all I love that the image can be rotated so that it can be hung upside down from the ceiling.The screen is just what’s needed to get you started to enjoy the quality projector!

reviewTitle: Good quality, easy to use, with enough accessories
reviewDescription: For its size, the quality is good, it is clear, it has its regulator which is easy to use, what I liked most is that it comes with accessories that you will need later so I don't have to buy them separately, like the lens cleaner, It is lightweight which is incredibly easy to carry anywhere.
This is a small projector that packs a big punch! Its powerful enough to use in a lit room, has built in speaker and Bluetooth, and comes with a screen! For the price, this projector is perfect!

Financially, things aren't the best right now. I found it unnecessary to buy a tv since I currently only rent a room. Out of all the projector's I've seen on Amazon, this one has the best reviews for a great price. The image is clear and the instructions are easy to follow. The fact that it can be used as a speaker is a bonus as well. Overall, it's the perfect size for my currently living situation. I can watch a movie or my favorite show and listen to it with it's built in speaker system or connect my bluetooth earbuds. I'm really happy with my purchase.

For the price, it works fairly well! You may want an external speaker to use for audio. But the internal speaker is adequate. Also the internal fan is fairly loud. I plan to use it outdoors so I have no problem with the fan noise. But I could imagine indoors next to you it would be slightly annoying. The keystone feature is just a simple tilt up or down.
Works exactly as advertised. Very please it’s picture quality and very easy set up
This projector is one of the best buys I could possibly buy. And for the cost it comes for it delivers more. Would surely recommend this

reviewTitle: Honest Review: Good Experience for the Price
reviewDescription: The projector does a very decent job for it's price. It looks well built, doesn't feel flimsy, but it's compact, which I like. It is very easy to use, comes with a clear manual, HDMI cable, a remote control, power cable, and a simple screen. The screen is very transparent, and honestly, the picture is way better on my white wall.The picture is clear enough, it is visibly blurred at the edges, though. I do recommend using a tripod, because any movement of the device changes the clarity, so you have to adjust it again.The strength of the lumens is not so high, so one should be in a completely dark room to see well, but for the price this is satisfying. Do not imagine super bright image as one on a TV. Actually, it does give a little bit of cinematic feeling over, because if the lightly darkened colours.It connected very easy with my MacBook Air wia HDMI, but I couldn't connect any of the three Android phones at home (maybe one should use a Chromecast). I had no problem with connecting external speaker via Bluetooth. The sound of the projector itself is not strong enough.The ventilator makes an audible sound, but it does the cooling job well enough. Again, as a budget solution, I would recommend this projector.
Really good projector, the screen is slightly cut off toward the corners, but still amazing!
Love how easy it is to set up and how clear the picture is. Just overall in love it with it and how small it is.
Just bought for the dorm and is much cheaper and accessible than a tv

reviewTitle: This is the best thing I ever have and the support is the most professional
reviewDescription: I have some problem with the projector at first but the support have contacted me and making everything right. Even now after one year when the projector has some problem, the support response very fast and help me the best at they can. They are the best brand so far in customer service professionals. The product is quality for the price!!!!
This projector has been fantastic since I purchased it on prime day. Works precisely like I had hoped. It provides a clear picture and is simple to use and set up. Perfect for my dorm!

reviewTitle: Works great and easy to use.
reviewDescription: This projector works great and has a nice clean image. It’s also very User-friendly.

Easy to startup and works with fire stick! Nice and bright. Works perfectly for our outdoor movie nights! Happy it connects to Bluetooth speakers as well for louder sound. Customer Service was great too as initially my remote was missing but I messaged them and they sent it out right away

I've been wanting a projector for a long time but never wanted to spend the money on an expensive one. I got this one on sale and I love it. The picture quality is nice. I recommend connecting a Bluetooth speaker because the fan on it can drown out the sound if your audio is coming from the projector itself. It's easy to setup as well.

The customer service of this company is top-notch.  When they discovered I had been confused about the fine print they went above and beyond to make it worthwhile for me.  We are enjoying the projector very much.  When I placed the initial order I worked with it for about 3 days and after reading and re-reading the fine print I realized that it does not connect to your devices for video through bluetooth as it makes it seem like it does (bluetooth is for audio only and the sound quality is not desirable for this), and you can also not stream video from a smart phone!  I almost returned this, but it was a great price and the concept was so fun.  We ended up purchasing an additional fire stick to use with it and that worked very well.  It has been awesome and a great time.  Just be aware you will need a fire stick or roku or similar for it to work!

I bought this at a good price and an overall happy with it. I have a blank wall in my bedroom that fits this projector nicely. I used the zoom feature to get it to fit perfectly.However, the screen has this odd dark spot in the corner (pictured). I cleaned the lens but it is still present. I am able to ignore it, but it is unfortunate. The projector also smells. I am happy to use it for now, but would upgrade if I was going to use this for longerKeep in mind it comes with an HDMI cord, but doesn't connect to USB-C without an adapter.

reviewTitle: Only functions as Bluetooth speaker with Apple
reviewDescription: Bought this to stream movies from my Apple phone or iPad but this projector functions only as a bluetooth speaker for these products. Not sure why I would ever need that.  Using a Fire stick- it streamed fine with very adequate picture for the price.  From what I can gather, I can buy an adapter to plug in the Apple products, I just didn’t want to spend more money to find out.Edit:  Fantastic customer service!  After the above review, I was sent a newer model with 1080 dpi.  It has a nice picture and I can share my iPhone screen but not movie Apps.  It still doesn’t stream video without a Firestick or Roku.  I can share slides from Keynote which is a bonus.  Print is not as sharp as with an Epson projector however.  Raised my rating due to the amazing customer service I received.

reviewTitle: Good picture, not compatible for mobile streaming apps
reviewDescription: We used it last night for the first time. We found the picture was better when we moved it further back than the screen size. There are no HDMI adapters in the set (only an HDMI cord) so you need to get that separately.  You NEED an HDMI to USB C adapter to work for your smartphone. Also popular streaming apps don't work on the projector if you use your phone. They'll work if you use your laptop though.We had to get an extra speaker set, too, because the projector can only do so much.Worth the purchase for my kids, though. Would have spent more money if I knew I needed to get so many extra cords, but I'm not mad.

reviewTitle: Great Projector for Small Spaces or Living Rooms
reviewDescription: This projector is perfect for small rooms or living spaces. The adjustable settings allow for easy focus and view adjustments, ensuring you get the best picture possible. However, the one downside is the lack of a volume control on the projector itself, but fortunately, you can manage the volume with the remote. Overall, it's a solid choice for anyone looking for a good projector.

reviewTitle: Worth the price - good first time projector buyer
reviewDescription: I wasn’t expecting any better than what this projector delivered., the picture quality was as mentioned just the audio Bluetooth out is mostly not so loud but feels okay for any regular speakerGood for first time projector experience

reviewTitle: It works for the purpose I bought it for.
reviewDescription: I've had a Epson projector before . This was a pretty good deal for the price. I project it onto my green wall, using my laptop. Blue Planet is always streaming for my dogs. I get the full theater effect. The speaker works,however I will be purchasing a nice Bluetooth speaker in the future for enhanced sound. The setup was very simple. It's small and can fit on a nightstand with a laptop. It's very portable. Overall, I'm pleased.

Like most projectors in this price point, you are not buying high quality glass. As a photographer and artist, I have to say that first so there isn’t a surprise when you wonder why sharpness falls off a bit in areas. This is a glass issue more than anything else. That said, the projector is the only one of four tested that actually streams from iPhone. For me, that’s a win. I need this for two reasons: image/art projections of stills and big screen indoor/outdoor projection for the family. Image quality is good, color saturation is okay—other units are better here, ease of use is good. Size is excellent. Literally fits in the top drawer of a desk! Have not used the screen yet…I’m sure it’s fine…your basic grommets on a heavy white sheet. Overall for price, for travel, etc…awesome.

I only gave this projector 4 stars because of the sound quality… it’s not the best, but you can hook up a bluetooth speaker. However, everything else is great. My one piece of advice is READ THE DIRECTIONS. Learn how to set it all up and how to focus and set up the picture… it will help. Picture quality is great, easy to travel with, and love that I can plug in my fire stick. Such a great purchase!
Very very dim.Expect to use this indoors only.60hz, but looks like 30.Has tripod mount tho....

reviewTitle: You get what you pay for
reviewDescription: worked fine for a while, but didn’t last a year. also, focus was never sharp.

I should’ve guessed by the price that this projector wouldn’t be very good. Really just a toy. Way too dim to use anywhere other than a dark room. Wouldn’t focus evenly. Lacks focus features like side skew. Although they claim it plays MP4 files, as soon as I tried it just displayed “UNSUPPORTED FILE”.**UPDATE** After I returned the projector, customer service reached out to me and asked if I would be willing to try their new projector. Presumably an upgraded version of the one I was sold. I agreed and was sent the new updated model. The new projector appeared the same as the original and after testing, I could find no improvement in the performance. It’s still too dim to use in even a partially lit room and still lacks the features I complained about previously. On top of that, it still wouldn’t play my mp4 files. Although their projector does not meet my needs, their customer service was great! Bottom line, you can’t expect this inexpensive projector to compete with ones that are several times more expensive.

reviewTitle: Might as well just get a good one
reviewDescription: #1 it isn’t really “portable” if I have to keep it plugged in to a wall outlet. My tv is portable if I unplug it and carry it around. I thought that was dumb. Comes with a hdmi and u have to get your own adapter to connect ur phone because it’s not Bluetooth. Have to get batteries if u wanna use the remote. Video Quality isn’t the best but it’s good for the price. Fans only make a small amount of noise and the speakers it comes with are decent for a small space and quiet people.
Screen came with dirt and stains on it from packaging. Projector can’t focus on the outside edges so it’s constantly blurry. Not the best…

I bought this for movies in the backyard. Which turned into use in the house. In the beginning it was working out great. I could only use it for night viewing which was fine. I assumed it wouldn’t be the brightest during they day because you get what you pay for, right? Well after about three months it started puttzing out on me. When I would turn it on originally, it would go straight to the home screen of the device I had plugged in to it, but around the three month mark it would go to a blank white screen. I grew very frustrated but figured out that if I turned it off and on a bunch (sometimes 15 minutes or more worth) of times it would go to the Home Screen and then I could watch tv. Well here we are a year after that and it won’t even stay on long enough for me to turn it on and off to get to my home screen.  The Manuel is helpless, the internet is helpless and now I’m just out money.

reviewTitle: Not worth the effort in my case
reviewDescription: The hdmi to usb-c option is incompatible with my phone, and the projector refuses to detect my chromecast (after confirming that the chromecast is perfectly functional). It seems the only option I have to watch anything is to plug in a flash drive and manually navigate to each file, which is much more cumbersome than just using my tv at the end of the day. Others seem to have different experiences, but I can't say I had a positive time trying to get mine to be usable.

I wanted to hook up my Roku but it didn’t load. So I went and purchased the usb to hdmi male cable to connect my phone and it didn’t connect… I don’t know what else to do so I’m sending it backThe picture did look good and clear I just don’t know how to connect
Kinda jenky didn’t really work great unless it was two ft away

The TMY Mini Projector, an upgraded Bluetooth model with a screen, impresses with its 1080P Full HD resolution, delivering vibrant and clear images for movies, games, and presentations. Its compact and lightweight design ensures easy portability for both indoor and outdoor use. Compatible with TV sticks, smartphones, and laptops via HDMI and USB ports, it also supports Bluetooth for wireless connections. Setup is straightforward, and the user-friendly remote simplifies adjustments. While the built-in speakers are adequate, external speakers enhance the audio experience. Offering excellent value for its price, the TMY Mini Projector is a versatile and reliable addition to any entertainment setup.
Super easy to use and the brightness and appearance is great even in a slightly bright room. Nice small projector

Absolutely happy to invest in a mini projector. This device is compact, has a pretty good sound quality! I connected my sound bar to give it more of a punch impact like I’m at the movies but in the comfort of my own room! I own another projector but it unfortunately decided to die after having for almost 4 years. I typically like to use this at night when I’m winding down because it’s not as great in a lit room but that’s okay! I’m glad I invested in this mini projector because I saved money by not having to fork out the extra funds for a smart tv. I’ve connected my Roku stick and I can stream just fine! reviewTitle: **  “Lesson Learned on a Flash Deal – Decent but Not Quite as Expected”
reviewDescription: I recently purchased the TMY Mini Projector, Upgraded Bluetooth Projector with a 100” Screen. While it does have some good features, it didn’t fully meet my expectations.The projector is affordable, and for the price, it’s a decent option. However, the picture quality feels a bit outdated. Despite the 1080P Full HD claim, the resolution and color vibrancy are not quite what I hoped for. It feels like an older technology, which might be fine for some, but it didn’t impress me.I made the purchase quickly to take advantage of a discount, and in hindsight, I may have rushed my decision. If you have high expectations for picture quality, you might want to consider other options. That said, for basic use, it works and is a budget-friendly choice.Overall, it’s a reasonable product for the price, but it didn’t quite meet my needs or expectations.

Not compatible with android phones. Directions arent helpful. You WILL need a firestick. It will NOT stream your phone apps (streaming services, videos or pics) directly from your phone. reviewTitle: Bluetooth doesn’t seem to be working, but a Roku stick/ express works great with it!
reviewDescription: It wouldn’t Link with Bluetooth with my phone, it did work with my laptop, but what I found to be the most practical was the Roku stick/express because now I have a remote to stop and pause things without opening up and fiddling with my laptop. The sound quality is also quite good. Apparently u can sync up speakers to it, but in a small room, not needed. Biggest annoyance with it this far is getting the adjuster perfect enough to get everything clear, and the adjuster itself is open ontop which opens it up to animal fur and dust to fall in. All in all, I got it for only 35 dollars on sale, so I am quite happy with it!
Has trouble connecting to Bluetooth but I have Roku so it works for me via hdmi

Connecting to WiFi and my streaming services was extremely easy. It was very easy to set up. The only downsides I’ve encountered so far is the volume. The higher the volume, the more distorted the sound becomes since it’s coming out of the projector. I highly recommend connecting to a Bluetooth speaker. Everyone in a while it will take a few minutes for the sound to start. Your show will start, but it’ll be silent for a few minutes. Not every time, but sometimes. Still a great purchase for the price in my opinion.
Can’t really change the size of the picture
Projector works well, fan motor is loud but not distracting.  Not capable of screen mirroring which is a bummer.

reviewTitle: Decent for the price, with caveats
reviewDescription: Pros and cons with this little projector. Overall, I think it’s a good value for the low price point. Setup is simple, and the included instruction card is helpful. We’re using ours with a Roku, and it connected right away, no problem.Sound is fine. Nothing all that impressive, but totally loud enough for watching movies with the kids.Picture is bright enough in a dark room. I definitely wouldn’t use this with any lights on, but didn’t plan to either, so that’s not a con for us. Focus is…okay. It’s hard to get the picture completely sharp. Using the knob to tilt the image at all makes half the screen unfocused. Even setting the projector up as high as we could to avoid needing angling/tilt, there’s still some blurring around the edges. Nothing insane, and again, adequate for our family. No one is complaining. But we did have to order a tall tripod because otherwise we’re stacking insane amounts of books up to put the projector high enough to avoid the blurring problem.Biggest con, really, is needing extra equipment to make this decent. Besides a tripod, we also had to replace the included screen, which is a joke and did not work at all, no matter what we did. It’s thinner than a bedsheet and distorts the image unless you put it flat against a light-colored wall…and then why do you need a screen at all? We ended up springing for a retractable tripod screen that cost more than the projector itself did. MUCH better.Anyway, overall we’re happy with this. Even with the added cost of screen and tripod, it was a much lower cost than other options. Everyone is happy.

Something is wrong with the remote. I've tried two sets of brand new batteries and both sets got super hot and started expanding. I did make sure I was putting them in correctly, so I have no idea what was going on. The first set would have caused a fire if I hadn't been paying attention. Luckily, I was holding the remote and noticed the battery compartment heating up. Tired another set of batteries, and the same thing started happening.So far sound is really good and picture is decent. I wish I could adjust the brightness levels so I could watch things in a lighter environment. Besides the remote, it's a pretty decent machine for the price.

The pictures are from the projector onto my children’s light blue walls. I have not even used the screen yet. I’m happy that I am able to Bluetooth speakers to it as the internal speaker is only good enough for a small room. I will be using it for outdoors as fall season is coming soon. Overall, I’d say this is a pretty good deal for the price it’s listed at. I’ve had other projectors and the fans were pretty loud but the fans on this one are really subtle and can’t really hear them when something is playing.

I have a soundbar connected via Bluetooth. Yall have to get this. It’s small and compact and the video quality is great. Easy to set up. Even during the day, it’s bright and sharp.

reviewTitle: Quick start to your first projector!
reviewDescription: I’ve always been curious about projectors yet they seemed so intimidating to get started! I’m so grateful to have come across TMY projectors as they provided and sent the projector, an HDMI cord, power cord, cleaning tools, a screwdriver, and an 80 inch simple projection screen with stickies to hang it up!It plugged in great and is user friendly so I could easily get started. It could even project on the wall with good brightness level if needed! Just make sure the room is dark and use the focus and keystone to adjust your picture.Thanks so much for making this available! If you had any hesitation to ordering, let it go. ORDER NOW ! :)

The quality of the build was quite good for the price (when I received it, it was on sale for under 70 USD total) and I was impressed with the picture quality, which was bright and clear.For my use case, I need the image to spread out across the wall with a short focal length, and I was happy that it will be able to do so. (For those of you who want to know, at 8 ft the image spreads out to roughly 80 inches, which is plenty for what I need it for).My only issue with the product is that the edges can be blurry, especially when spread across a wall. This is hardly an issue when watching TV or movies, but can make some small text unreadable when displayed at the edge of the screen.Otherwise, I am very happy with the projector overall.

Has multiple functions where you can adjust the frame too, if you have it propped up at an angle, it lets you invert, slant, zoom accordingly.I will say the fan is a bit loud, sounds like a older PC tower type of white noise but it’s not so bad that you can’t hear the audio. The other downfall is that you can’t connect your phone to it to play videos thru your phone or whatever but still not too big of a deal.

So I got recommended this form a friend, that being said, I was never one for small mini projectors. I'd seen them all over Tiktok and the like, but they never struck me as anything I'd want or use. Until I was hearing about this one from my friend. So with my first paycheck of my first job, I decided to try it.Now I'm not here to sound like it changed my way of thinking and made me contemplate sweet existence, but having the ability to have a screen, that doesn't have 3 Dimensional space, that can be either very large on a room wall, very small display somewhere, or even being a monitor positioned directly upward above my bed, this has to be the neatest thing I've had in a bit. It's lightweight, meaning you can throw it and a power cord in a bag easy, it's smooth at 60Hz, not 30, and being 1080p means that it's visible from close or objectively far away distances.As pictured, it's still bright in full room light conditions, and blacked out lights off, where it's more vivid, great versatility.I personally love this projector. I'm not gonna say best purchase I ever made because buying food is neat, but so too is this projector. It also came in White which fits a bunch of my computer theme anyways so that's just neato.

I’ve been using this projector for about 1 month now, find it to be very useful as I don’t want to mount a TV to the wall of the bedroom. I have the projector sitting level on a wall mounted shelf right above my bed. It shoot out and projects a 100in screen right in front of me. I watch tv at night and the light from actual tvs is very bright so having the projector throw the light onto the wall instead of my eyes helps with sleeping too if I wanna leave a show on and sleep. The sound it makes is a pretty quiet whir, I can’t sleep without a fan making noise so it adds another hum to your room to fall asleep to and if you’re watching in the daytime it also isn’t too loud. I’ll say you really can’t watch this in the daytime, it’s not bright enough for it unless you have blackout curtains. It works best at night or a closed room. The quality is wonky like sometimes the top and bottom will be fuzzy but the middle is clear. It’s not the greatest video quality but it’s doable and I enjoy watching shows/movies on this. Speakers will fray the sound if you raise the volume too loud, I keep it at 18 and it sounds really good. You’re best friend is going to be a google chromecast tv dongle and remote. The chromecast remote will let you avoid using the projector remote as you can program the Google chromecast remote to turn off/on, change volume, and select HDMI as input with it. So I don’t really use the projector remote it came with, I just use the chromecast remote to control the projector and the shows I’m watching. Good projector for the price.

Being able to hook up a system like a switch or PlayStation is a great feature to have.

Happy to finally have one of these!

It has exceeded my expectations and I am very pleased with my purchase.

The old 8 MM movie projectors with 25 to 50 watt halogen lamps gave a tolerable image on a silver screen about five feet wide. We got used to it, as 16 MM film was expensive for home use.For a toy home VIDEO projector this one is OK and significantly better than an 8 MM film projector in a number of ways, but there is a problem with the brightness of the output as described.This explanation may get a little geeky, but in the end you will see why the ratings given to projectors are useless. The consumer is led to believe that the brightness of a projector output is rated by a standard measure of "lumens." There is some deception in that. A real "lumen," as described in my ancient high school physics book is "The amount of visible light flux which falling normally on one square foot of area will produce an illuminance of one foot-candle." Translated, light a common candle made of whale fat, hold a sheet of paper that is one foot in height and one foot in width exactly one foot away from that candle, and the light falling on the paper is (Ta-Da!) a foot-candle and a lumen. Two candles - twice as much light. Simple.Look at the box a light bulb comes in. Somewhere on it will be a lumen rating. As an easy example, an old 60 watt screw-in incandescent light bulb puts out about 600 lumens. So since this projector claims to have 7500 lumens it should be super-bright, right? It is in fact no where near capable of outputting that many lumens.I mentioned that I had purchased three video projectors. My main one is a solid BenQ projector with a halogen lamp similar to one you might see used in an art gallery to illuminate a painting. That projector has a rated output of 3,000 lumens. It projects onto my 14' diagonal screen with a brightness that is easily equal to what I was used to in movie theatres. I have been more than satisfied with its performance.My second projector purchase was a little Crenova I bought to play around with. It is an LED projector (meaning the light bulb in it is a long lasting and forgiving LED) and has a rating of 1200 lumens. I would put that rating as inflated, but would not be surprised if it in fact put out 800 real ANSI lumens. I knew it wasn't going to be great shakes.Now we come to the projector in this review. It is rated at 7500 lumens. To compare the three projectors, I just now projected the same movie from the same source onto my 14' diagonal screen, using each of the three projectors. The BenQ, at 3,000 lumens filled the entire screen with gorgeous brilliant images, even with ambient light.The little Crenova, at 1200 lumens made a barely acceptable image on about half the screen (8' diagonal)This TMY projector, brand new, put out an image that was about twice as bright as the Crenova, but less than a third the brightness of the BenQ with a six year old halogen lamp in it.So what is going on? The definition of "lumen" is the problem. The BenQ, I suspect, used the original definition of lumen in an honest measurement environment. The little LED projectors use a different lumen called an "ANSI lumen." The American National Standards Institute (ANSI) decreed a different lumen measurement to be used in evaluating projectors. Unfortunately, rather than calling the new measurement "SquintHard" or something other than lumen, they co-opted the name, and stuck an "ANSI" in front of it. Carton designers have no reason to know a lumen is different than an ANSI lumen, and "lumen" gets stuck on the box and in advertising today.So what is an ANSI lumen? - apparently whatever you want. Supposedly it is the noticeable difference between a 100% white, a 95% white, and a 90% white that a projector puts on a screen in nine different locations, where the differences are just noticeable, with the screen size taken into account via a formula. Try to get the actual IT7.215 ANSI spec sheet and you run into a paywall. Gee, how consumer friendly...I can't say that a 7500 (ANSI) lumen rating is a lie, but I can say that some people in product testing are troglodytes, eat lots of carrots and can see in the dark, while most of us slog along as average folks with developing cataracts and other issues.Bottom line - do NOT believe the ANSI lumen ratings of any of the LED projectors as a meaningful method of comparison. My BenQ projector uses almost 300 watts in operation, with the bulk of that going to power the lamp and cooling. If you want light out, you have to put power in. If you want bright, understand that you may need to trade off and accept some bulk and heat. OTOH, if you want an inexpensive toy for kids or to use on a back porch while you swat madly at mosquitoes until giving up and going inside, the LED projectors may work for you.

I really wanted to like this because it was a birthday gift to myself!  But as soon as I’m able I’m going to return. The only pro is that the  picture quality is not bad, but trying to adjust to an even picture is almost impossible. It’s like skewed but the left side it always longer than the right even if the top line is even. I tried to find a solution online but nothing. The menu doesn’t have an option to play with the pictures degrees. Not to mention  I use my Roku on this and it doesn’t allow for cec remote set up. It’s irritating bc I have to have both remotes handy for certain features instead of just using my Roku remote. For example volume buttons. Speaking of volume it , isn’t very loud unless you put it on “ movie” mode and when you put it louder it sounds scratchy. The  focus ring and the keystone lever are poorly constructed and next to each other that when you move the ring, the keystone moves as well. Not to mention if you move the keystone either the bottom or the top will be blurry. Doesn't make for the best viewing experience. 😞 I was hoping the reviews were right, I was so hopeful. Gotta try again I guess.

I really was ignoring the 1 star posts in hopes the 5 star folks were accurate,  but I pulled it out of the packaging and tried to Bluetooth connect my phone and it didn't work, tried to connect to my T.V and it paired, but still no picture. I changed the input to USB and try to plug my phone in. Again no worky. I finally unhooked my firestick from my t.v. and plugged that in and it worked great. The picture was pretty good as hoped, but the fact I could not connect my phone made me frustrated and disappointed. I am thinking of returning it because I wanted to use it where I have no wifi and I have cell service. Grrrrr. I read the FAQ and nothing worked. The sound was fine if you are indoors, but I need to buy a speaker to watch movies outside with the grandkids. 1 star. Buy it if you have minimal expectations.  Maybe a play room for kids to watch movies and pour milk on it. IDK.

The focus isn’t great. It’s clear in the center, but hard to get the edges in nice focus. Really only works well in the actual dark, not dusk. The thing that ultimately is giving this a 1 star is the sound level. It’s garbage from the unit itself. So I hooked up my super loud Bluetooth speaker to get around that problem. Well, with my Bluetooth speaker on full volume, AND the projector all the way up to 100 volume the sound is still super quiet garbage. So it’s as if the projector keeps my Bluetooth speaker from going up as high as it should period, so you have to almost sit by the speaker to hear the movie well. Not with the money.

reviewTitle: A huge letdown in a small package *UPDATE 9/21
reviewDescription: *Update 9/21I got some scam-looking email from someone claiming to work for this company asking for my personal information and payment details so they could “refund” the amount in exchange for taking this review down. . . Please!! Head my warning and stay away! This is not ok!!The unit arrived well packed, with a generous sized screen, easy instructions for setup, and the majority of cables you would need to setup and have it running out of the box. Unfortunately, this is where all the positive notes end.The unit has brightness, contrast, sharpness, tint, and color settings. All of these have what can only be described as little to no effect on the picture. The speaker built into the unit is a fancy touch but it has the audio quality of a 1980's era walkie talkie from Caldoors. The picture is usually washed out unless the video you are playing has a dark scene and then it is ok. The focus ring is either broken on mine, or its designed poorly. You have to rotate the projector lens itself or hold the unit upside down or else its almost like there is something locked in place that won't allow the focus ring to turn properly. All in all for being the price point it is, I am not expecting my screen to look like the main theater at an AMC but I should be at least able to read the menu and playlist on VLC with the focus ring turned as best as I can under the circumstances. It's just not worth the cost.Also, you will need to supply two AAA batteries for the remote as it does not come with them.

reviewTitle: Projector does not work and terrible customer service
reviewDescription: My projector was not working. I contacted the company twice to resolve the issue; however, they did not respond at all! I then contacted them a third time, asking for a refund, and they did not respond either. If you plan on buying this product, please do some research. I do not recommend this product to anyone, and if I could return it and get a refund, I would, but they refused to answer my emails. Also, the company does not have a phone number, so that should say something about the company.

Notice in pictures & videos provided above. This product is most definitely not 7500 lumens or 1080p full HD. Unboxing the product I was excited, it looked sleek and well made. The second we got it plugged in and tried to get it focused we noticed that once you get the center of the image focused the sides become blurry (notice in 1st picture can barely read the word boost in bottom right corner). Could hardly see anything unless the room was completely dark. Playing the game I couldnt see anything clearly that wasn’t right by my car. Trying to adjust the picture settings, the changes aren’t even noticeable. I’m returning this ASAP. I wouldnt even want my kid having to deal with this.**EditAfter posting this review the company’s customer service contacted me. They sent me a newer model that actually works within 2 days for free. About 2 weeks later (today for me) I get another email from them. Stating that since they sent me this new product, which is a different one than this review is for, they would like me to take this review down as the representative’s pay is affected by it apparently.I replied stating the review for this product is true, and cannot be bought away by a better product being sent. In which they responded they meant they wanted me to change it to a 2 star rating for the customer service. In which my response is this edit to the review. I stand by what I said for this product and the proof I showed. The new product is great, but that does not mean people shouldn’t know this one isnt.

Well, the projector is ok, but far from good.The equipment looks nice, well made and they provide everything you need to connect it to whatever you’re connecting it to, including the projecting screen, which is nice. However, when you turn it on, the image is beyond disappointing! I bought it to use outside, but I was not able to watch anything until it was completely dark! Bummer!! I didn’t expect it to work perfectly outdoors, obviously, but it didn’t work at all!!! Until, like I said, it was completely dark.The picture I posted here is from inside and I really expected it to be better. It’s not! The quality of the image is ok, but it’s not something that you would consider having to use as your gaming screen, for example. I guess you get what you pay for, but almost $90 is definitely too much for what it offers.One last thing: I couldn’t connect to the Bluetooth, God knows why!I will return it because it does not fulfill my needs. I was hoping for much more!

This projector lasted barely a year and its already so discolored. I use this projector as a TV and I’ve done nothing to mess it up. Every time I look at it, the quality gets worse. It was perfect at first and I loved it, but the picture and sound quality declined so quickly - I can’t believe it. The fan is so damn loud I can barely here whatever I’m watching. My sister always complains she can hear the fan from ACROSS THE DAMN HOUSE. If I turn the volume up past 50 it distorts the sound. TRASH! DONT BUY (unless you want a projector that lasts about 10 months).

I usually don’t leave reviews but this thing pissed me off so bad. I bought it cause it was on sale for Prime Day and I wanted a projector and was so excited for it. Got it, set it up, plugged it into my computer and it was working fine for the first couple of minutes. But then the screen started flickering. I unplugged it and then plugged it back in and now it won’t turn on. The light just stays red the entire time. Ordered a replacement, so hopefully it was just a faulty product. But wow, it can’t even last 15 minutes is astonishing.

It was easy enough to set up and the picture is pretty decent for the price. It hooks up easily enough with my computer, phone, and Xbox. The speakers are not very loud, but that was expected for the price. Bought it back near the end of 2023 and we have used it for quite a bit and have had no issues with it. The only issue is the picture gets fuzzy around the corners of the picture and we haven't been able to clear it up no matter how much we have tried.

reviewTitle: My Boyfriend and I love this set!
reviewDescription: The projector and screen both work very very well for turning your room/living room into an In home theater. The projector itself does have a decent speaker. The sound quality is pretty good and does get super loud. if you’re looking for more of the theater experience, I would definitely recommend connecting via Bluetooth to either a sound bar or speaker. The picture quality is definitely not 4k, but more along the lines of your average priced TV. It looks great on both our wall and the screen included. I wasn’t looking for anything fancy, so if that’s you, this is definitely a must buy!  With coupons and a sale, I only payed $56 (originally listed for $99.99). Definitely super affordable and a great enhancement to movie night. Very very pleased with this product!

**Updated reviewI definitely have to change my review somewhat on here.After I posted my first review,  the company reached out to me,  and offered a newer, updated version of their projector.  It has bluetooth capabilites, etc.Now, while this projector was a little more difficult to set up, due to everything being in Chinese,  and requires mirroring on your phone,  I managed to set it up. Picture was good.However,  if you use your phone,  plan on not being able to use it, if you're having movie night,  as it will (obviously) mirror what you're looking at, seeing, etc.I did not love trying to set this up and get it going.  It may be easier for someone else that is tech savvy.BUT,  I did reach out to the company with my new review,  told them my issues, and they gladly refunded my money.  The customer service was phenomenal, and they were patient with me,  as it took me a few days to try to use the new one (due to work and trying to move).  With all this being said,  I would Not hesitate to try to buy from them again!! They kept in touch too see how things were going,  and when I told them my issues,  they were on it!!Again,  maybe I'm just not technically inclined,  and may work easier for someone who is.  Regardless,  thumbs way up for their awesome service!!I honestly thought I was buying a projector with Bluetooth in it. Somehow after researching and reading reviews..I missed that it did not. Swore I read that it did. So that's on me.  I have not taken it out of the box until last night,  after purchasing it Months ago.... to realize it's not what I wanted.  I had to take my firestick out of the TV and hook it up to projector, etc.  Its not super loud,  but I'm sure you could connect to a speaker to make it louder, especially if you're gonna use it outside. Picture is just OK.  I would've returned it, had I set it up immediately and used it. Again, on me.  So I will just try to sell it,  and look for a different projector with Bluetooth, etc.  The reviews were good, and trust me,  read a lot, on a lot of different projectors, and decided this was would be good.  This was is not for me.
Love the pic quality - hate that doesn’t have C port connector ; everytime I turn it on I have to change it to hdmi it doesn’t stay on the setting although firestick stays connected

I had some reservations based on the reviews but this little thing is pretty great to me. It’s obviously not as great as a 4k TV and does work better at night but it does the job I needed very well with my Fire Stick. It can be a bit noisy sometimes but that doesn’t bother me much.

Highly recommend if you don’t need projector in a set place to watch movies or tv

reviewTitle: Defective product,...the seller is not responsible for the bad product
reviewDescription: I bought the project in December, that is, less than two months ago and it is already presenting failures, a large black vertical line that starts from the upper edge and ends at the lower Edge (this line is getting bigger and bigger) , I contacted Amazon so that they could please collaborate with me with technical support product or change it, they say “we can't do anything because 30 days have passed”... so they contacted me directly with the TMY seller, they tell me that because I live in another country where the distributor is located, they don't replace the product... that is to say, more than 100us in the trash for a lousy product that did not appear for even three months of good operation, and a profit that is useless at all,... if you want to buy a product of poor quality and with very bad support this is the one, and very bad for Amazon that accepts this type of sellers and does not give confidence to its customers.... they also tell me that if I want I can return the product but they will only return 70usd, that is to say less than 30 usd of what it really costs...
