reviewTitle: garbage broke after less than 5 uses
reviewDescription: I bought this at the end of summer in august to use for outdoor movie nights with my children. I might of used it 4-5 times max and always stored it perfectly. I brought it out this weekend for Memorial Day excited to use it and it didn’t work. I haven’t even had it a year, so it’s in the 1 year warranty but Amazon said they can’t give me a replacement. The picture on it was blurry and the colors were dark and didn’t translate properly when in use and always skewed. My young children didn’t know any better but any adult would. The picture also was never clear, it always blurred out half the frame and the background picture was never clear.  In the picture you can see how SpongeBob looks green instead of yellow and how it’s impossible to have it fit full screen because it doesn’t focus then. I’m not sure how it got soooo many positive reviews but more people need to be honest. Super disappointed and waste of money if you want a projector I would save up for a better brand and model that’s what I’m going to do instead of throw $70-80 down the drain since it’s now in my garbage.

I was looking for a projector that wouldn't break the bank since I would be using it for outdoor use. Took it camping and set up the screen in the trees. Worked perfectly and the kids enjoyed movie night in the woods.

If you’re thinking about getting a projector for your home, get this one now!!! It’s so easy to set up. I did buy an additional HDMI to USBC cord to hook up my iPad to it. For a while I thought it didn’t work but I just figured out I had to choose source on the remote and choose HDMI and then BOOM it worked. Great quality, volume works nicely and doesn’t make a lot of excess noise from the fan inside. I didn’t use the projection screen because it works fine on my wall. The projection screen is also very thin.
The project came with good instructions. It was easily to set it up in my room. It looks great and the video it produces is also great. The brightness is great, too. I love it.
My daughter has in dorm instead of tv, the quality is great and easy to set up. Thinking about purchasing another for our tv room to give us more space.

Great size and price. Our first time using a projector and setup was easy, instructions provided was helpful — we loved that we could connect our speaker via Bluetooth. Perfect for our outdoor movie nights!
I love it! It such a big screen and I’m obsessed with it. It’s better at night for obvious reasons but as long as your room isn’t bright you should be able to watch it during the day too!
I bought this projector for my son and roommates to use at their dorm and they all loved it. They been using it to project and watch movies.

overall i’m super impressed! the projector easily connected to my alexa for better audio but the audio that comes out of the projector itself surprisingly was even better than i thought. the fans a little loud but what’s the problem with white noise. finally it came with screen which was even better!
This projector is great! We were checking different price points and this one had excellent reviews and was reasonably priced, so we got it! You won’t regret it!

This is a good little projector for what it is.  Don't expect movie theater brightness, and definitely don't expect high quality sound, but if you want to send an image up on a 10 foot screen in a nearly completely dark room, youve got a fun night ahead of you!I've played with numerous "low cost" projos over the years, many of them claim to offer all the bells and whistles, some say they can connect to your wi-fi and allow you to stream from your media server (nope, still haven't found one that does that), but this one looked like it was going to be focused on projection instead of all the other gimmicks.The brightness is better than most of the low cost models.  I did the basic setup in a daylit dining room and was able to see the entire viewing area without terrible washout.  Darkness and use of the provided screen looks generally adds to the experience.  The video quality from a 720p source video projected onto a roughly 8 foot viewing area was on par with "movie theater" at a viewing distance of about 20 feet.Somewhat disappointing is the inability for the projector to pass AC3 sound, which almost ALL videos online have now (depending on where you get your online videos).  If you are using a USB drive for your source video, there's no way to change the audio source.  If using something like a firestick, change the output sound to PCM so you can pass the audio.  I honestly do not like "non Dolby" audio, so I developed a work around by using a rasp Pi media controller to send the video to the projector and the audio to an external surround sound controller.  This would be a more than exceptional setup if this was a permanent mounted projector, but honestly, this isn't that sort of rig.For the casual user, this may work out.  if you can get an OTG cable for your phone and send your screen to the projector, maybe..  if you want an affordable setup for yard movie nights for the kids, this is a good deal.

We wanted to do an outdoor movie night and this worked great. We used the Bluetooth for a speaker and the connection was perfect and we used the Roku to stream a movie from Disney. Everything worked great and the picture was really good. For outside you do need to wait until it’s almost dark for the best picture. Which is expected with a projector. This is small and easy to pack, easy to figure out, seems fairly durable but I haven’t had it long term yet. It has a nice sleek look without any major knobs or buttons sticking out.

My family and I had been looking for a protector that we could use outside on our patio. This has all of the bells and whistles that we were looking for. We can’t wait to use it more in the spring when the weather isn’t so hot!

reviewTitle: One of the best purchases made!
reviewDescription: This projector not only was super easy to set up, but I was able to view my movies, videos, etc. with super clear quality. Thank you for this projector!!

I ordered this product for my child's birthday party. I was a little worried because of the reaaonable price that the quality would be low but my husband and I are pleasantly surprised. We love it! This product is excellent!

Was very impressed with the picture quality and clarity of this projector. We have used it multiple times and all the ports, features and ease ability to set up and use have been a bonus. Great affordable option!
The projector was an amazing purchase! Once I figured out how to mount the projector I was in business. The manual is super easy to understand and connecting my fire stick was really quick!
Product is easy to setup, and has great connectivity. Sound is awesome and just very happy with it

reviewTitle: A good projector for a good price.
reviewDescription: This projector is my first and seems to be a good beginner one at a affordable price.
The setup was really easy. The sound quality wasn’t as bad as I thought it would be. My mom loves it and can’t wait to watch movies in bed on a big screen!

We used this on our vacation to watch movies outside. It was fantastic. Easy to set up and use. Only suggestion is to use a good Bluetooth speaker if you are outside. Built in speaker works great indoors.

I took out of the box, plugged it in, connected the Roku stick, it connected to my wifi. And viola I was watching Prime movies. I'm a dummy at connecting stuff usually and typically get frustrated that nothing works, but that didn't happen. I was shocked how fast I was enjoying this thing.The quality and brightness, I'm thinking it's pretty dang awesome for $65. The $500+ models must be amazing. I'll take this for the price I paid all day long. The pic is with some daylight peeking in too, so guessing night will be great.The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is because the Bluetooth to external audio connects/pairs ok, but no sound is generated. In fact it's silent because the projector volume turns off because it's connected to the Bluetooth device, but no sound.
Buen precio sin embargo en 2024 y que un dispositivo necesite un adaptador como un fire TV no convence mucho
Does its purpose but Dan is a bit noisy if it doesn’t bother you then it’s ok

reviewTitle: Lot better with the new and improved version
reviewDescription: The new version is brighter and shows more color. Good to take camping or do a quick movie for the kids or show the football game on

reviewTitle: It's just barely ok UPDATED REVIEW
reviewDescription: Below is my original review. I believe it still stands in regards to this projector. But the customer service team was good enough to reach out and send me the upgraded version of this projector, which comes with wifi, Bluetooth, a quieter fan, and brighter picture. Customer service is pretty great from this company.The fan is loud. There is an option to update the software, but no instructions on how. No where can I find a website to download software for this projector. I also can't find a list of supported file types to play from USB or TF. It seems to support some mp4 videos but not others. The speakers are very quiet. You will absolutely need external speakers. Also don't be fooled by the 1080p support. It seems to only be native 720p. The upgraded version with Bluetooth and wifi might be better but this the one I got. You will also need something like a fire stick to stream Netflix, etc. There's no built in wifi in this version. The remote works but it seems to be IR instead of RF so you gotta be pointed at the right spot to use it. But it does work ok if you aren't expecting a lot. Also the price jumped up by like $15 right after I ordered it.

1. PictureGood brightness. I have nice about 11ft away and the brightness is good and it’s clear image. Somtimes when I turn r on a picture won’t display but I can hear the fires tick moving around so I have to turn it off and then on again.2. Fire stickI use a fire stick it works normal with it. THE DEVICE DOESN’T HAVE BLUETOOTH so I I can’t connect my Alexa to use it as an external speaker (at least for everything I’ve tired)3. Sound. I have It like 4ft from me and most moives are loud but a couple movies have been quiet (midsummer on apple tv). I haven’t bought external speakers yet. The fans are louder that I thought though it does become background noise after a while and most moives are loud enough jt almost blocks it out. EXTERNAL SPEAKERS WOULD ELIMINATE THIS PROBLEM almost completely4. RemoteWhile the remote is flimsy it works and unless you chew it or throw it it not an issue. IT MESSED UP MY LED LIGHTS. Due to the fact it has an infrared light it communicated with my led lights and my normal remote no longer works. So basically broke my lights

Honestly I wasn’t expecting much. We got an amazing price on prime day! Trying to configure it wasn’t easy to begin with. I wish it had a function to allow you to enlarge or minimize the picture but I doesn’t. I expected crappy quality and sound based on reviews but the picture was fine (not like a TV but still good) and the sound was louder than I expected. We didn’t really need an extra speaker honestly but we wanted a theater experience so I attached our Bose portable speaker and got more of a movie experience. Trying to set up the projector in the perfect spot was challenging. We found a kitchen barstool and put it on top of some books at an angle but there’s got to be a less janky solution, lol!Overall I’m glad we made this purchase and it’ll definitely be our go to for movie nights!Our picture was too big for the sheet that it came with so we used a blank wall.

reviewTitle: 10 cosas positivas y 2 Negativas para que sepan
reviewDescription: como proyector es muy bueno, pero tengo algunas criticas. Lo positivo.1 El audio se escucha bastante bien. 2 Es bastante silencioso comparado con otros. 3 es fácil de usar. 4 Tiene buena definición 5 anda netflix y etc con fire stick, chrome, etc. 6. La resolución para hacer screen mirror con un celular y un fire tv es muy buena. 7 los contrastes y colores se ven muy bien aun sobre una pared  común.  8 es 220b-110v. 9 la entrada USB soporta amperaje para alimentar otros dispositivos, esto es algo  muy bueno ya que alimenta directamente y fire tv.  10 muy buena potencia de proyecciónLo Negativo:1  La  lente  frontal, no  es de buena calidad. la mia vino con imperfecciones lo cual afecta  en algunos lados la proyección.2 La MAS IMPORTAnTE, El equipo no tiene regulación de zoom in out  de pantalla. Osea NO se puede regular el tamaño de la pantalla proyectada, ni con lente ni de manera digital. Esto es algo muy malo, ya que la pantalla sera del tamaño que le de la distancia del proyector, y eso hace que tome dimensiones no deseadas en el lugar donde lo queramos colocar haciendo que quede horrible la proyección sobre objetos que están al rededor. O sea para que quede claro, si uno lo quiere poner en una pieza, de 4 mts por ejemplo, la pantalla proyectara una imagen de 3mts de ancho que no se puede regular, pisando muebles o ventanas, etc. Esto me parece un punto muy,muy flojo que se podría haber solucionado fácil, con una lente.ESPERO LES SIRVA2

This projector is a great price with the discount coupon and performs as expected. Keep in mind it's an inexpensive piece of equipment, so you're not going to get amazing. I gave 4 stars simply to reflect that fact. We bought this to use with our RV and outside on the garage. We've only tested it thus far and the test went well. The black contrast is lacking, but that's not surprising as it's a budget item. The sound is ok, but can be made great with an external speaker. We recommend the external speaker. We successfully wire connected the projector to an Android tablet watching a movie over wifi. We had zero issues with lag and the Android device recognized the projector without issue. We have not attempted to use with an Apple device as we don't have the proper cable for USB to lightning. For now, we plan to use this with the Android devices in our home.Our primary use for this system will be with our RV. We opted to forgo a tv in the RV since it goes against our intentions behind why we have the RV and everyone already has a tablet they can download a show to before we leave home for those times the weather forces us inside. The screen that comes with is rather transparent, so we recommend using it on a solid surface to prevent bleed through of the design behind. We plan to attach it with suction cups to the exterior wall of the RV. We can also use it inside the RV in a similar manner.

We’ve used this inside and outside a few times since our purchase. The picture quality is okay. The bottom right corner is never in focus, but it’s not enough to take away from the experience. The built in speaker buzzes and crackles during most speaking parts and therefore we have to use CC subtitles. Currently in the market to buy speakers with a compatible headphone attachment so that we can actually hear the words clearly. The screen that it came with is nice. Only used it twice, as our walls are plaster, and the double sided tape for the hooks fall off the wall, and take pieces of the wall with it. We lost the remote shortly after using it the first couple of times, so it’s nice that there are buttons in the actual projector. We love that we can plug our Amazon Fire Stick into it. Overall, not a bad purchase for the price.**Update: After creating a review, customer service, seeing I mentioned we lost our remote, contacted me and shipped me a new remote, free of charge. With such great customer service, I’ve added another star to my review.

The projector is not very bright.  In a moderately lit room, it was almost unviewable.  We had to turn off half the room light to see the image on the provided screen and even then it was unsatifactory.

Not a brand I kept. Had to buy elsewhere. Easy to use but not very good. Sound is awful. Not bright AT ALL! Had to buy port for iPhone to HDMI cord. It says all over how it’s Bluetooth but then says it’s not Bluetooth haha. It’s not Bluetooth to a phone. Did not connect to phone, laptop or tablet. Does connect easily with fire stick tho.
As soon as I unboxed the “new” projector I noticed deep scratches on the lens. I never even used it and sent it back. 2 stars for the inconvenience in sending me a used and damaged product.
Good things.Very bright, easy to use,  quick return policyBad thingsHdmi port would not recognize any device plugged into it.Would of probably enjoyed it if only hdmi worked

reviewTitle: Not great pic quality and Bluetooth is only for audio
reviewDescription: I bought this thinking I could eliminate cords but the Bluetooth is audio only and I could not get it to pair with anything. The quality of the picture is not great either

I thought mine was faulty. So I sent it back and ordered an exact replacement. The projector will not connect to WiFi, when I get to the network menu it freezes on me and I can’t select any thing or cycle through the options. I reset the projector and my WiFi  twice. I sent an email requesting trouble shooting for the issue and never received a response. On top of the lack of being able to connect to network the projector lags

When I first bought this one, it was as a replacement for the one Amazon completely wiped from their sales history. Caution when using this one as dust WILL collect fast and you’ll need to clean it religiously. Although small, the fan is loud enough to hear even while volume is up. After a while of having it in however, I noticed a black line form across my screen. It crept across the entirety of it until it started to form a circle in the corner. Started off small but day after day it gets larger and is starting to effect my viewing experience. Honestly is I’m buying a piece of appliance, I’d rather not have to replace it once or twice a year every year

Purchased in January 24 and initially loved it!! We bought a better screen and used this projector all the time. Unfortunately by July the picture has gotten terrible with no hope of resolving. We've tried everything. Figuring it's just reached the end of its life.
I can only watch shows if I have it plugged in toY laptop, I could not connect via Bluetooth with my tablet or phone.

Not great during the day. Hard to focus and keep focused. The free gift icon on the main screen gives a url address to nothing. The ability to custom size the screen for limited location ability would be nice as well. It works, but not well. Even at night it isn’t very bright after playing with different settings, which really doesn’t change anything.

Does not work not easy to set up. Does not come with proper cords. Advertisers connections with roku/netflix/hulu but set up instructions has two paragraphs, one of with states it cannot be connected to any due to liscencing.Refund is also 30 days from when they recieve it back in China.....returned to usps on August 19th refund eta is September 31st.

reviewTitle: Sound sucks can’t use phone all around sucks
reviewDescription: Can’t connect phone need to connect via HDMI & if you connect say laptop or whatever then you can’t ALSO connect a speaker and the speaker on it SUCKSJust avoid all together. Spend a couple extra bucks and get something better. If for indoor use might be ok outdoor? Avoid

It has tiny, useless speakers, and the Bluetooth only lets you send audio to the projector, not video. The only practical way to use this is by having it plugged in with hdmi. I’d have to run a 20 ft hdmi cable around my room. Pointless waste of money.

I initially gave this mini projector a good review based on its performance during the first test. However, after using it a second time, I encountered significant issues. The projector didn't work as well as before, with problems including poor image quality and connectivity problems. Unfortunately, it seems the initial positive impression was short-lived, and I’m very disappointed with its overall reliability.

reviewTitle: Picture and sound very Poor quality
reviewDescription: Very poor quality the middle of the picture was okay after a lot of adjustments but the sides were very blurry and I couldn’t get it better also the sound was terrible I had it plugged into speakers I also used Bluetooth and I couldn’t barely hear it and I know that my speakers are very loud and workAnd I am in the process of returning the projector I do not recommend this product get something else

After a week of using the projector, the audio and remote stopped working. The audio cuts out shortly after the projector is powered on. The remote loses communication with the projector and none of the buttons will work. It has to be unplugged to turn it off.

I bought this product Oct 9th 2022 and it randomly shuts off quite often. I have black spots on my screen when watching shows that looks like there’s something wrong with the lightbulb. Does not have the ability to power hdmi cables. I really wanted this to be worth the investment long term and it unfortunately was not. I would say keep looking.
skip this.  buy this one. AuKing Projector, 2024 Upgraded Mini Projector, Full HD 1080P Home Theater Video Projector, not paid for this. this one is just 10x better  and brighter

I purchased this projector with the plans of watching movies with my kids. I received the box in perfect shape. However when I opened it to set up it would not do anything. It would not connect to my fire stick or any other device. So it’s getting returned. My kids and I are very disappointed with this projector.

Bluetooth doesn't work at all. Won't work. No matter which way i go about trying to connect, it just won't.Once I finally figured out i needed a special cord to connect it with my phone and projected the image onto the canvas, after 3-4 minutes it just shuts down. Like I have to be constantly interacting with it or the screen dies even if I turn off that feature on my phone.The picture quality is about as good as you could ask for the priceHowever, i'm the inability to actually use it peacefully just kills it for me.Unfortunate that i'll have to return it for something different.
This projector is great for camping trips or slumber parties on the trampoline.  Keeps the kids busy!

I bought this for my tiny home because the living room could not old a normal TV. Set it up outside in the backyard and the screen fits perfectly on the back fence. Cant wait to have people over next weekend for a movie night.

I’m no projector expert but this one is perfect for me! I set it up on my porch with no trouble at all, and hung the included screen on my railing and movie night was born. The opening ceremony of the Olympics was great fun outside with the neighbors. A+ purchase!
Honestly works better than expected. I love that it came with so many accessories. Super happy with this purchase.

I love this little projector. I initially ordered it just for backyard movies, and I had low expectations. It’s so easy to set up, the sound isn’t bad, but if that’s not good enough for you, it easily connects to a Bluetooth speaker. It’s small and portable so we will definitely be traveling with it. Love it, highly recommend.

reviewTitle: It's a low cost projector that's plays off hdmi and compact storage for less than $80.
reviewDescription: I used a USB to play media and was able to use Samsung Dex using a HDMI to USB-C. The screen seems to get pretty big all things considered and can still be adjusted for tilt and focus. It doesn't play as 4k video quality but still looks very good. I play the video off the ceiling and the wall for the kids and my wife depending on how we want to relax to watch it. I have a small bag to travel around with diapers and the projector fits fine in the bag with the power cable since its just a power cable with no bulky power supply. Also it's not heavy either. For playing media off the USB  the one of the working formats is Fat32.
Projector quality is surprisingly well given the price. It's worth it if you are on a budget.
We bought this for use at our camper and it is awesome!! I can’t believe how clear the picture is. Well worth the mi ey for sure!
Love this projector! It was easy to set up and has great features! I wanted a projector for my living room area and this fit perfectly. 10/10

Excellent little projector for the money. I was able to hook up an external speaker and use a fire stick to stream. Super easy to setup and use! If you have any issues with an external speaker via Bluetooth, use the auxiliary cord. It will fix any delay with sound.

reviewTitle: Could only get it to connect to the PlayStation
reviewDescription: I got this in February to use for picture projection. I let the kids use it to watch movies from the PS4 and that worked great, but I have tried every cord suggested to project pictures and nothing. USB thumb drive, HDMI to phone, micro SD, none of them could be read. It's fine for the kids to watch movies from the PS4 with, but not what I bought it for and very disappointed. A friend told me I shouldn't have got one without Bluetooth. Now I know.

very low-quality projection and it no longer works after several times. The projector is still grainy and blurry, even after focusing the lens as much as I could. I like to say it has a grainy vintage camera feel but, it's hard to read captions and words on the stuff I'm projecting. This happened recently but it suddenly just turned off by itself and now it won't turn back on. It might be broken I don't know. Overall, I don't recommend it. Please choose a reputable brand and preferably not on Amazon as it is full of crappy quality products that should never have been manufactured in the first place.

reviewTitle: Would get the next model up
reviewDescription: The projector is okay but not my favorite. It came with fingerprints on the lens and lens cap missing but it’s supposed to be new. Then the zoom could not adjust like said in the manual from 32-70” I believe. The words are blurry but the actual movie plays fine. I wouldn’t get this model and I think I’m going to return if I can’t figure out how to adjust the zoom.
Could not find tmy blutoothOn the projector. My phone either. Bought projector to stream movies with my phone but did not work.  So waste of money.  Dissappointed

The first time I used it it did good and looked like I was going to like it a lot. However the next time as I was watching things, it kept loosing focus. I had to keep adjusting it.Also the sound started off really loud and great but as I kept using it the sound got lower and lower. And wouldn’t turn back up.Little to say I sent it back and will be getting a different one.
Woulda been nice to mention it doesn’t come with the lightning to hdmi cable - good job making it look like it does though

reviewTitle: Not worth the price. Pay upgrade
reviewDescription: I un this item was not high priced. Given that, the picture quality was iffy at best. My thought would have to be for the screen. It’s basically a white sheet with grommets on the corners! Perhaps something a bit more substantial lightweight canvas likely would helped. The other thing I did not like, not being able to size the picture according to distance of screen to projector. If one is limited on the amount of distance they are allowed, the unit should be able to account for that by sizing up or down the picture. Sound quality?? None!! Definitely have to hook an external speaker of some sort. If I had the chance to return I would. Skip this item and don’t go cheap like I did 🤨🤦‍♂️ I’m dry going to upgrade and get what I pay for next round

reviewTitle: Get ready to strain your eyes
reviewDescription: Finally got around the setting this thing up, and was pretty disappointed. I thought it would be cool to try and set the new living room up like a mini movie theater for my husband, but it's like trying to watch a movie at the theater when you've forgotten your glasses. No amount of fiddling with the settings got it anywhere close to watchable. I tried to sit through a movie but just got a headache from eye strain. The video quality is just not good. It was super hard to read things, so anything that has subtitles is impossible to watch, even if you can get past the blurry & washed out picture quality. The fan is also quite loud. Will be returning.

I bought this projector to use for movie nights with friends and family. After hooking up an Xbox one, I realized that it is just impossible to focus the whole screen to an acceptable level. The very middle of the screen focuses decently, but the rest is extremely blurry to the point that even large text is entirely unreadable, especialy on the left side. Nothing I can do will fix this. For the price, I knew it wouldn't be the greatest picture quality out there, but I at least expected it to focus well enough to read text. If you want a projector to use somewhat frequently with decent picture focus I would not recommend this one.

We were happy with this projector the first time we used it. The sound doesn’t get very loud without reverberating. Unfortunately, the second time we used it there are splotches on the top of the projection picture. It was stored in the original packaging and well taken care of.

I was really excited to get this, all to be disappointed. Don’t get me wrong. It’s a nice picture. But the worst of it is when it comes to the focus, you have to finagle it until you can get a good picture on top of that though when you do get it, it’s blurry on the bottom or on the sides. So for me, it wasn’t worth getting.Update- The company did reach out to me, and I got a replacement and it works much better. Thank you!!

*** Update***After my initial review of the unit just dying, the company contacted me and offered an "upgraded" unit with WIFI. I accepted. So far, the machine powered on and works as expected. Seems to be very similar to the broken projector, except for the controls, as this one has WIFI. What I would really like to point out is that I was passed my return date. The company read my review and contacted me to offer me a replacement at no cost to me. Customer Service is HUGE to me! Kudos to them for stepping up and doing the right thing. So far, this unit is working exactly as it should.***Original Review***Used this projector literally only 3 times. It just died in the middle of use. It no longer will power on. Huge waste of money!!

It's not the highest quality projector but for the price I love it. I use my Google Chromecast. The volume is not bad, I thought I'd need to use a speaker based on reviews but I haven't set it up yet. The projector audio is fine for me in outdoor use. I think it'd be nice if it was a bit smaller.

reviewTitle: Great little projector for the price
reviewDescription: Purchased this projector for family movie nights for the summer.  Seems great for the price.  Wish it came with more adapters.

This works just as advertised, one thing i noticed that i didnt consider was the noise the fan makes.  Make sure your volume is up.  The onboard speaker is decent but would sound better with a sound bar or bluetooth speaker.  I am happy with my purchase, make sure you adjust the tilt on the lens before you focus as it can cause uneven focusing.

The projector was relatively easy to set up, and it came with...yes...another remote control and several cables (HDMI to HDMI and AVI cables---which I keep giving away to a probably not too grateful Goodwill even though I still have a working VCR/DVD player with AV outputs).  I was not able to connect my cell phone to the projector.  I need a different cable for that.  But I used the HDMI cable to connect my laptop to the projector in just a few minutes.  I wanted an inexpensive projector as I just did not want my cats pawing at my TV screen.  The field of flowers in the second photo IS muted (the bee is a better representation of the color).  The color was really a lot better than I expected.  I have it set about as small as it can go.  I have not set up the screen yet.It is nice that the bee's buzzing sound is sent to the projector.  I can turn the volume way down to avoid being driven insane.  The fan on the projector is relatively loud, though.  It would have to be tuned out if you were watching a movie.The remote does not have batteries, which works for me as I use rechargeable batteries and am glad to spare the land fill two AAAs.For what I paid, I'm impressed so far.

I was in the middle of choosing a TV or projector, well you know what I've chosen...this projector! It's easy to set up (I recommend buying a stand). It can be very noisy, the picture quality is good (not outstanding), and the brightness is enough not to blind you. Overall, the product is good, reliable, durable, and a great investment.

reviewTitle: Good if not using bluetooth for video
reviewDescription: **quality of image is much better than the photo I’m posting- it was also raining in this pic so I have the projector inside of a small tote to protect from elements**So I bought this to host a tailgate style birthday party outside (at night) around a bonfire. I’ve had projectors before so I automatically bought a fire stick with it. I think if you are going to buy a projector on the cheaper side having the fire stick or some other streaming device is the answer.Once synced up, projector worked great. I also Bluetooth synced up a JBL speaker to enhance sound. Projector does have speaker that would be loud enough for a normal setting. Comes with thin screen, would be great if used against a solid color wall. Has eyelet holes to tack into place. I used with a tripod backdrop stand and it worked well outsideThe only reason for not a full rating is the fact that I was not able to set up Bluetooth video as the instructions indicate (Apple phone), I could just be doing it incorrectly. HDMI did work fine as I tried that with my computer as well but chose the fire stick to use for video.

I use this projector for my bedroom it's displayed on a blank wall. I had ordered one from the same brand that came with the projector screen and then ordered this one at the same time to compare since the image was bigger than the projector screen I didn't need it and kept this one instead of the sound quality is really good. Yes, the fan is noisy but I haven't known a projector to not make zero noise. It's not distractingly loud at all. I also am not sure if I can make a fair comparison on how the image looks in the daytime. It's very clear and crisp at night and the evening. I don't want to get black out curtains so I just watch TV in the living room during the day. The remote works fine. My projector did not come with a lens cover and the first one I ordered from this company. Also did not come with a lens cover. I will say I connect mine with a Roku and when I do the screen projecting through Apple Mirroring the sound is delayed, so I just do it through Roku. Although I got the one that has Wi-Fi connection since I have a Roku, I have not found it to be a necessity.

reviewTitle: This projector does exactly what it says, and looks great!
reviewDescription: I have wanted a projector for years, but the price for these products seemed stuck at $600 for a decade.Finally though the technology is at a point where there is a lot of healthy competitors and it’s leading to great budget projectors with good features at the right price.I purchased this projector on prime day. My expectations were low as I did not think something so low in price would be capable of a decent picture. I was wrong. Very wrongThis projector looks great for sports. Track, baseball, soccer football etc all look good on this. I even held a fight night party outside for my friends on this and it looked great. Picture quality wise, it falls somewhere between 720p and 1080 and honestly I’m fine with that. I use this with an 84 inch screen so when you think about it your getting a device capable of displaying an hd image up to 200 inches screen size for less than $100.00 usd. WoW!There are 2 downsides though for this price. No Bluetooth. While it does have hdmi and usb inputs, Bluetooth really is missed once you start hooking things up.When you first get this projector, the dark backgrounds of some movies are way to dark and the whites (like a boxing ring white) were way to bright. Luckily, you can customize the picture settings with the remote that comes with this to balance it out.Some reviews said the projector is loud but honestly once your show or movie starts you don’t notice it.Other reviews stated the built in audio on the projector is not good which I disagree with. If your using this indoors it gets the job done. Outdoors I would recommend cheap $10-20.00 usb bookshelf speakers.  Leta be honest, the audio on $800 4k TVs these days is awful and it’s almost mandatory you get a sound bar. The fact this can outdo those sets for 10% of the price says a lot.Finally, this comes with a real manual. It’s in English and the manual actually is useful. It’s short, 4 pages in length and is refreshing. I bought a tv for my parents last year and after hooking it up we spent 30ish minutes downloading updates and creating accounts just to use it. With this projector, you turn it on, plug it in, adjust the lens as needed and enjoy your show!

i figured out how to connect it to my computer via usb but i read the entire directions and was never able to connect it to my iphone. :(. It has a surprisngly good quality for the picture though and you can adjust the focus easily to make it as clear as possible.

It’s cool but I wanted to do a picture slide show from my phone but you’ll need a hdmi adapter. I’ll have to wait for it to be delivered no one in the reviews or the manufacturer says that.  I guess fine otherwise.

I could see this working for some people, but didn’t hook up to my computer as easily as another I bought. However that one’s Bluetooth speaker was very low, whereas even with a louder fan, this one has a decent volume output.

reviewTitle: Works great other than 2 minor issues
reviewDescription: I bought this for my daughter because it advertised Bluetooth. The Bluetooth does not work.  We are still able to use it with a HDMI adaptor (purchased separately).  Quality is good.  Sounds is ok.  The projector itself is a bit loud.Overall would have given it 3.5 stars but that wasn’t an option.

Im preparing for my art class in September. What I want to do is project my paintings in stages from initial sketches to final product. Directly from my iPhone. No worry about incompatible devices for viewing anywhere we set up our art materials. Now, will this projector do what it says?

Revised Review:I my first review, I awarded the product 1 star; this is revision of my initial review:  Once this seller read my initial review, they worked with me to get one of their better quality projectors.  Even though the Amazon return date had expired, we were able to reach an agreement so that I felt I received a fair deal on a better machine.  Kudos to the company for their very good customer service.Initial Review:Unfortunately, I just missed the return date by a few days.  Go ahead and spring for the cost of acceptable quality.  Our daughter is graduating from college and my wife made a video presentation of family and friend photos.  We worked and worked with this projector and even redid the video, hoping to have decent projection quality with no luck.  Images were blurry and individuals in some slides were unrecognizable.  We could not present this.  We went ahead and bought an epson and WOW what a difference.  Don't waste your time and money.  Now I'm stuck with this thing that is of extremely poor quality and of no use.  This company should be more honest about their product; it will disappoint.
The price and quality for this product is really good, however it was awful to set up with Chromecast!! But got it to work eventually, enjoy it very much !

I needed a TV and went with this cheap option. I wish I spent a little more on a better projector because the video quality is lacking. It doesn't seem to be 1080p resolution it is more like 720p. Also for whatever reason I have to click input and change the setting every time I turn it on. Not a big deal and im happy with my purchase nonetheless.

Great product, easy to set up, it's small appearance is deceiving too. Used it with a fire stick and a PS5 and it's done great! Only complaint is that you can't adjust the size of the projection aside from moving the whole system.
Everything is great about the projector except the sound. We had to connect it to our speaker and it was still very low…

We are so excited to have finally purchased this projector. It is lightweight and streams with great quality. To our surprise it came with a screen so that was an extra perk. We plan to purchase two more in place of tvs in our new home. We love it as a great alternative to our kids room because they are toddlers and love the experience of the projector. Ease with setup, Bluetooth compatible and we will be looking into a fire stick.

I initially purchased this projector based on its many positive reviews and Amazon's deal of the day offer. It arrived within two days, and I was excited to set it up. I ensured I had all the proper cables ready to connect to this highly reviewed projector. After plugging it in, it started up smoothly. However, when I connected the provided HDMI cable to my laptop, it showed "No source detected." I tried multiple devices and different cables, but nothing worked.Believing the unit might be defective, I returned it and requested a replacement, but I am still hopeful. The replacement arrived quickly, and I was impressed by the excellent customer service. With high expectations, I set up the new projector and connected it to my devices. This time, everything worked perfectly!The picture quality is fantastic, and I'm thrilled with the performance of the replacement unit. The brightness and clarity exceeded my expectations, making movie nights a joy. The projector is easy to use, and the connectivity issues I initially faced are now entirely resolved.Overall, I'm beyond satisfied with my purchase and the excellent customer service I received. If you encounter any issues, don't hesitate to request a replacement, as the company stands by its products and ensures customer satisfaction. Highly recommended!Original Review:Saw this projector with many positive reviews. So, I had high hopes from the start. It was also the deal of the day (or whatever Amazon calls it). Came in within 2-days. I ensured I had all the proper cables I would use to connect to this amazing high-review projector. I plugged it right up, started purring and working great. I connected the provided HMDI cable to my laptop. "No source detected." Hmmm...maybe the cable isn't of good quality, so I grabbed one I used to connect my laptop to my home hub...still "No source detected." Let's try the USB-C to HMDI cable for my Samsung Tablet. Nope! Samsung Phone Nope. Okay, Google Chromebook. NOPE!!!Nothing I plugged into it worked. I went through five devices and three input sources, and still, "No source detected." Okay, this one may be defective; send this one back and receive the new one unboxed (with high expectations still). Plug everything up, "No source detected." I even ordered a new HDMI and USB-C to HMDI cable and nothing. Please do yourself a favor and go with another brand; nothing worked for my connections and what I was trying to connect (tablet, Chromebook, laptop, cell phone).The picture was nice, but that's where it stopped. I will spend more money and get a quality project that will work as intended right out of the box.

So my first mess up was forgetting I was ordering from Amazon us.. bring in the UK I completely overlooked the plug. But my dad had a little kettle type plug that does the trick.When I straightened the image up from the awkward angle I put it to just test it then used the other focus wheel I noticed it was blurry towards the edges shifting the position wheel again to slightly off angle it cleared this right up. This is a quick clip from YouTube just to see if it came on, on a old stripped wall that's waiting to be decorated. I can only assume it will improve more with the actual screen sheet which comes with it! Bonus!I have 2 light sources in the room a small lamp and the back lighting from the TV and my curtains are open it's not "dark" out or inside and still gave this image which only got better when I did close the curtains.I was not expecting cinema quality and had already dug out my speaker to attach but it doesn't even need them, you can change treble and bass and it gets very loud I had it at 20% volume here in this clip.You get the hanging pegs and sheet... Having never owned or been around a projector the fan sound did not bother me..it added to the charm, wasn't loud but was at an expected volume for a little mighty machine putting out some serious work!I got this for my garden for movie nights, to play music videos along with music or watch my fave shows on while I chill out. I am more than happy with it and it far exceeds my expectations. Remote works well and my fire stick works well I will have to have a play and see if I can get music through speakers while streaming but for the price! I live in the UK as I said and this was around 11/12 pounds shipping from the US! That would be 13/14 dollars for that alone then the Ultra low price it was worth the gamble and for me it's paid for itself.Sure all the projector buffs who are comparing this to a 2k state of the art machine will be choking on it's perceived faults... But this is a tiny projector that can be pretty much packed up and taken anywhere, with decent sound and image and a vast array of options for which they even provide you the cords to connect! They are essentially comparing a cinema screen to a off brand 32in telly. This is perfect for me and I would buy it again.

Set this up outside and watched a movie with the neighbors. Great for what you pay and to have a fun experience. Can’t beat the price and was not looking for anything other than being able to do movies outside. Delivered. Easy to use with a fire stick.

reviewTitle: Im happy with my new projector
reviewDescription: Im really happy with this projector. Recently the screen of my 60 inch tv on my bedroom crack and and i didnt want to spend over $500 to replace it so i got this projector and its the best decision i made. Now i have a 100 inch "screen" on my bedroom wall.*Easy to use*Fast bluetooth connection

Great quality for the price! Easy to use and hook up a TV Stick. Picture quality is actually crazy good. In my space, it projects on the entire living room wall with excellent picture quality that you sometimes lose at that distance.

reviewTitle: Compact and portable for a affordable price
reviewDescription: Did not have high expectations based on the price, however was very surprised how well it worked. Easy setup and being small did not take up much room. Family enjoyed watching movies outside. If it came with a USB-c to HDMI cable it would be a slamdunk!

I just love it. Everything worked great and the picture was really good. We used the Bluetooth for a speaker and the connection was perfect and we used the Roku to stream a movie from Disney. And the most important thing is that is super easy to setup. I think for the price is perfect.

I wanted a projector for my kids to watch movies in their room. I decided on this projector after reading reviews on other projectors and so far I’m happy with the product. It’s not a perfect clear picture like cinema projectors but it does the job and my kids love it.  I hope it lasts more than a year.

We love this projector for our outdoor space! The screen is perfect for our setup and the sound is pretty good though we would like to add a sound bar in the future. Overall we’re extremely happy with this purchase!!
Traveling in 1 week! Now I have to reorder!! Why are they sending low quality items in the upgraded box?Hopefully I get a new one in time for my trip!

reviewTitle: Just bought it and it already has spots
reviewDescription: I just bought this projector and only used it once. After the first use I was really happy with my purchase. Unfortunately, after the second use there are little spots on the screen. I thought it was just lint on the projector glass and I tried wiping it off. But it looks like it's coming from the inside. This is the third video projector I have purchased in the past few years, and having worked in movie theatres for years I am well aware of what light output is required for acceptable presentations.  An indoor auditorium of average size (40' diagonal screen) usually used a 2000 watt xenon short arc as a light source when projecting 35 MM film.  Drive-ins used to have carbon arcs that were far more powerful than that for the 100 foot wide screens that were often used.  Fast forward to home projectors.The old 8 MM movie projectors with 25 to 50 watt halogen lamps gave a tolerable image on a silver screen about five feet wide.  We got used to it, as 16 MM film was expensive for home use.For a toy home VIDEO projector this one is OK and significantly better than an 8 MM film projector in a number of ways, but there is a problem with the brightness of the output as described.This explanation may get a little geeky, but in the end you will see why the ratings given to projectors are useless.  The consumer is led to believe that the brightness of a projector output is rated by a standard measure of "lumens."  There is some deception in that.  A real "lumen,"  as described in my ancient high school physics book is "The amount of visible light flux which falling normally on one square foot of area will produce an illuminance of one foot-candle."  Translated, light a common candle made of whale fat, hold a sheet of paper that is one foot in height and one foot in width exactly one foot away from that candle, and the light falling on the paper is (Ta-Da!) a foot-candle and a lumen.  Two candles - twice as much light.  Simple.Look at the box a light bulb comes in.  Somewhere on it will be a lumen rating.  As an easy example, an old 60 watt screw-in incandescent light bulb puts out about 600 lumens.  So since this projector claims to  have 7500 lumens it should be super-bright, right?  It is in fact no where near capable of outputting that many lumens.I mentioned that I had purchased three video projectors.  My main one is a solid BenQ projector with a halogen lamp similar to one you might see used in an art gallery to illuminate a painting.  That projector has a rated output of 3,000 lumens.  It projects onto my 14' diagonal screen with a brightness that is easily equal to what I was used to in movie theatres.  I have been more than satisfied with its performance.My second projector purchase was a little Crenova I bought to play around with.  It is an LED projector (meaning the light bulb in it is a long lasting and forgiving LED) and has a rating of 1200 lumens.  I would put that rating as inflated, but would not be surprised if it in fact put out 800 real ANSI lumens.  I knew it wasn't going to be great shakes.Now we come to the projector in this review.  It is rated at 7500 lumens.  To compare the three projectors, I just now projected the same movie from the same source onto my 14' diagonal screen, using each of the three projectors.  The BenQ, at 3,000 lumens filled the entire screen with gorgeous brilliant images, even with ambient light.The little Crenova, at 1200 lumens made a barely acceptable image on about half the screen (8' diagonal)This TMY projector, brand new, put out an image that was about twice as bright as the Crenova, but less than a third the brightness of the BenQ with a six year old halogen lamp in it.So what is going on?  The definition of "lumen" is the problem.  The BenQ, I suspect, used the original definition of lumen in an honest measurement environment.  The little LED projectors use a different lumen called an "ANSI lumen."  The American National Standards Institute (ANSI) decreed a different lumen measurement to be used in evaluating projectors.  Unfortunately, rather than calling the new measurement "SquintHard" or something other than lumen, they co-opted the name, and stuck an "ANSI" in front of it.  Carton designers have no reason to know a lumen is different than an ANSI lumen, and "lumen" gets stuck on the box and in advertising today.So what is an ANSI lumen? - apparently whatever you want.  Supposedly it is the noticeable difference between a 100% white, a 95% white, and a 90% white that a projector puts on a screen in nine different locations, where the differences are just noticeable, with the screen size taken into account via a formula.  Try to get the actual IT7.215 ANSI spec sheet and you run into a paywall.  Gee, how consumer friendly...I can't say that a 7500 (ANSI) lumen rating is a lie, but I can say that some people in product testing are troglodytes, eat lots of carrots and can see in the dark, while most of us slog along as average folks with developing cataracts and other issues.Bottom line - do NOT believe the ANSI lumen ratings of any of the LED projectors as a meaningful method of comparison.  My BenQ projector uses almost 300 watts in operation, with the bulk of that going to power the lamp and cooling.  If you want light out, you have to put power in.  If you want bright, understand that you may need to trade off and accept some bulk and heat.  OTOH, if you want an inexpensive toy for kids or to use on a back porch while you swat madly at mosquitoes until giving up and going inside, the LED projectors may work for you.I'll keep this one because of A: the low price, B: A slightly easier menu system than the Crenova, and C: for jokes, like projecting ghosts on Halloween.  I won't be using it to project "Lawrence of Arabia" or start a drive-in.  I am deeply disappointed in the lack of brightness compared to what was advertised, but not overly surprised.  If chocolate bars and cereal boxes can shrink in size for the consumer, why can't light?

reviewTitle: GREAT value, not the best but VERY good for the price :)
reviewDescription: GREAT value, not the best but VERY good for the price :)My biggest complaint would have to be that it has a strange sort of blocky picture. hard to describe really. Its like the picture quality is actually pretty impressive, but then there is sort of a grid of sharp, shadowlike, squares on top of the quality image it projects. you can see it inside the bulb when its on if you look at the bulb from the side while its projecting. Very strange and i dont understand why it's there. If you are picky about image quality this would probably bother you quite a bit. But for me, it is easily overlooked once you get into whatever it is your watching or projecting. For me it is not as noticeable or bothersome during playback while things are in motion and its easy to forget its there after a few minutes but i have owned another projector around this price range for about 4-5 years which was actually a lower native resolution than this one is (480p i believe). With that projector, the image was noticeably washed out from the start, but there was no such "shadow grid overlay" at all. this one is much better quality image overall, and WOULD be exceptional IMO if it werent for the grid thing.things i love about it though make the grid easily tolerable.1. It REALLY is a very small and portable size for the quality and size of the image it projects. VERY lightweight and something i see myself ACTUALLY taking places with me on occasions.2. Love the fact that it comes with a foldable easy to carry screen that is convenient enough to pin up almost anywhere3. has great customer support at a great price :)4. has all the features youd expect from a projector like the ability to flip the screen in any direction with the remote.5. Runs VERY quietly, ive got it hooked up to an HDMI cord that runs to a Monoprice HDX-401TA box which has 4 additional hdmi ports so you can switch between inputs on the box and it will display through the projector. it also has a port for optical audio out which i then hook into a surround sound/blu-ray player so that anything that is dispayed on the projector plays the audio through the surround sound. while using that setup at moderate to low volume i literally dont hear any fan sound whatsoever coming from the projector.

reviewTitle: Nice projector for the price - but it is NOT 6500 LUMENS!
reviewDescription: For the price this is a nice little projector. I didn't need a new projector, but when I saw a 6,500 Lumen projector for less than $100, I couldn't resist out of curiosity. It might be 650 lumens, but there is no way this thing is anywhere as bright as it claims. I had to turn the light off in my living room to be able to see the picture clearly. On a positive note it comes with an HDMI cable and there is not a huge block attached to the power cable - just a standard skinny power cord. The screen is just a sheet of material with some plastic connectors to hook it to your own frame - a DIY sort of deal. For $90 it's a decent deal, but don't be expecting it to work unless you have a dark room or at night.

reviewTitle: This is NOT a bright projector

Projector is decent for the price.User Interface is easy enough to navigate and IO options allows for user preference.Instructions included detailed various setups and suggestions for troubleshooting.I was interested in the TF/SD Card option for the mobility-factor.Upon trying to play some movie clips; the projector states they were unsupported.I read the documentation about file support; and it does detail file types supported.Lists 11-types; I use 1080p - MKV, MOV, and MP4 files. When trying to play those files; its states that they are not supported.So, made a clip and converted it to the various video-formats.Video of testing and picture of files attached. Disclaimer - I don't own video: made for testing.File types that I got to work was the AVI-720p, MP4-640P, and FLV (not listed).It does what its made to do and to convert files to AVI-720p is only an option for those who have a video-editor. It's cool regardless.
